intro: Barleria papillosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety appearance. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple, arranged in dense spikes. Barleria papillosa is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas, and it thrives in full sun.
